alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON COUNTY... At 517 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from I-26/I-526 Interchange to near Edisto Beach, and moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Edisto Beach, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Fort Sumter, Johns Island, and I-26/I-526 Interchange. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
